newsitem.title: USA: CBOE, PHLX, AMEX and PCX to list new options.
newsitem.headline: CBOE, PHLX, AMEX and PCX to list new options.

text.p: The Chicago Board Options Exchange and the Philadelphia Stock Exchange (PHLX) said Tuesday they would list options on Check Point Software Technologies Ltd on May 13.
Also, the American Stock Exchange (AMEX) and Pacific Exchange (PCX) said they would list options on Hertz Corp on May 9.
The CBOE and the PHLX said Check Point options would open with strike prices of 22-1/2, 25 and 30 and initial expirations in June, July, October and January.
Position limits at the PHLX are 7,500 contracts.
At the PHLX, G-Bar Ltd has been named specialist for Check Point options. At the CBOE, Group One has been named designated primary market maker (DPM).
For Hertz options, opening strike prices would be 25, 30 and 35, with initial expirations in June, July, September and December.
Position limits of 4,500 contracts have been set at both the AMEX and the PCX, the exchanges said.
At the PCX, the options have been allocated to Amy Farnstrom. At the AMEX, Group One has been named specialist.
